inn1.comm: dream start! I mean an absolute dream start for Sri Lanka as Guptill is on his way with a lazy waft outside his off stump. Truly one of the softest dismissals you will ever see in an ODI. Guptill has a half-hearted swipe at this gentle loosener outside his off stump, and ends up tickling an edge to the keeper, who takes it comfortably with a dive to his right
goes aerial through gully as there is some interest from the slips, but ends up landing safe. That would have been interesting if that went closer to fourth slip

123 kph, that should have got him. Delivers this one angling in from outside off as McCullum is late on it, with Sangakkara unable to glove it from behind as he gets struck on the left thumb. Not sure if he had edged it, but Sangakkara is now getting some treatment as the finger gets taped up. Quite a painful blow that. This one looks to have straightened just a touch after landing at a length just outside off. Looked almost certain to nail the off stump, but surprisingly did not
124 kph, sensibly allows this length ball outside off to go through to the keeper
126 kph, coming in from outside off now as McCullum shuffles over a touch to try and work this away through the leg side

126 kph, bowls a beauty outside off which nips in to strike the top of his pad as the ball ricocheted over to Sangakkara. Kumar sees Brendon has advanced down so he fires in an under-handed throw at the stumps, but no dice

134 kph, what did the Sri Lankans have for breakfast exactly? Begins with the perfect line just outside off which any batsman worth his salt has to play at, with the ball nipping mischievously away at the last moment
136 kph, this time straighter outside off as Williamson is able to get forward to run this through the gully region
137 kph, has found his spot right away as he gets some shape outside off on a fourth stump line, and at a good length
135 kph, in control of proceedings as he delivers a slightly fuller ball that swings away as McCullum looks to slam this over extra-cover, but is late on it
138 kph, this time shifts it a touch closer to McCullum's body as he forces one away with a slice through the off side

138 kph, dropped and McCullum's patience runs out as he attacks this length ball outside off, going down the track before slicing this through backward point, where the master, Dilshan, waits, but is unfortunate not to get fully behind it as the ball bobbles out of his grasp. Was certainly in good position there, but it looks like the ball was just struck too firmly by McCullum

125 kph, drives this one uppishly through extra-cover, with the extra-bounce not allowing him control of it, but he did pick the gap to find the boundary as the fielder put in a desperate, but fruitless dive at deep extra-cover
127 kph, this time lets it through outside his off stump to the keeper
124 kph, drives this one firmly on the up to the man at long off, but hits it a bit too well for his liking
126 kph, gets forward to steer this length ball outside off to the cover fielder
126 kph, nice swing of the bat as he lifts this length ball gracefully over long off to find the second boundary of the over
126 kph, shifts his weight onto the back foot before punching this away for a single through the covers
137 kph, overpitched outswinger which Brendon laps up as he strikes this cleanly through the cover region, not worried at all to keep this down as this blasts away to the boundary
141 kph, almost yorker-length delivery just outside off which Brendon wisely defends on the front foot
138 kph, delivers another outswinger, this time on middle and leg, as Brendon is squared up
137 kph, overpitched again from Lakmal and he is fortunate that McCullum did not place this as he drills this emphatically at mid off
136 kph, traipses down the track to try and heave Lakmal through midwicket, but ends up getting hit on the thigh guard, with the ball ricocheting to the off side
134 kph, leans forward before clipping this fuller length on the pads through midwicket for a brace
125 kph, length delivery wide of off stump and punished by Williamson as it should as he finds the gap between backward point and point to get four
123 kph, looking to steer this fuller one through the off side, but the swing into him means he ends up striking it more to midwicket
126 kph, realises he needs to attack as he comes down to belt Kula through midwicket. Was early as he hit through the line, but gets the desired result
124 kph, rocks forward to defend this fullish length towards the off side
125 kph, gets good shape from outside off as Brendon inside-edges onto his pads
124 kph, gets nicely back before working this away to the leg side to end the over
140 kph, slipping onto the pads and Kane is in a rich vein of form as he just caresses this off the pads with a delightful flick to find the backward square boundary
136 kph, shifts his line of attack to outside off stump as Williamson sensibly lets it go
135 kph, gets some good bounce to this outswinger on a fullish length, with Sangakkara taking this quite high up on the body as he reached to his right
135 kph, length ball just outside off and shaping away as Kane keeps out of the line
134 kph, driven away off the back foot, but finds the cover fielder

131 kph, tries a similar delivery to the one before, except a touch shorter, as this time Kane finds the gap to punch this on the up off the back foot to find the extra-cover boundary, despite the fielder doing his best to try and cut it off before the rope
123 kph, tucked away off the back foot towards square leg for one
126 kph, looked like a slower ball as Kane watched it carefully go by, but the speed gun suggests otherwise
123 kph, slanting across Kane as he uses the angle beautifully to work this down to deep fine leg
124 kph, into position quickly as he defends this one away with soft hands

127 kph, strikes McCullum on and around off as Kula likes this one. They were looking to review it after the umpire ruled it not out, but after a lengthy deliberation, it looks like they won't pursue it, and for good reason as replays confirm this did indeed strike outside off
124 kph, defended away off the back foot to end the over

138 kph, outswinger which is overpitched by Lakmal as Williamson latches onto this in a flash, executing an elegant drive through extra-cover to get four more. Has been a class apart in this innings so far
137 kph, excellent movement off the pitch as this one leaves Williamson from just back of a length on middle and off as he looks to defend
134 kph, slipping onto the leg side as Williamson glances to backward square
138 kph, uses his feet to turn this fullish length which was going down the leg side into a low full toss which he just about gets away with an agricultural slog through cow corner to get a boundary
138 kph, gets nicely forward to defend this fuller one from Lakmal just outside off
136 kph, squirted away off the back foot towards square leg, but can't pinch the run
124 kph, plays this one late just outside off to get a drop single
123 kph, length just outside off which is defended with soft hands
123 kph, delivers this one just back of a length outside off as Sangakkara flicks the bails behind after McCullum overbalanced after misjudging the line
123 kph, this time fended away to the off side, but can't get the single
123 kph, gets forward to defend on the same line, except this time the ball bobbles up as he arrives early on the ball, but lands safely on the off side
122 kph, brings the bat down to direct this down to the man at long on
137 kph, defended away to the off side by Williamson
134 kph, gets high on his tippy-toes to work this back of a length down the pads to midwicket

134 kph, Lakmal has already bowled some superb delivers this spell. This is another one. Gets this to just angle away on a length outside off as Kane is forced to play at it, but is lucky not to have offered up an outside edge to the keeper behind
133 kph, bit shorter now on the same line except this time Kane is able to get safely behind it
132 kph, defended away on the front foot to the off side by Williamson
134 kph, fuller this time on middle and leg as this is worked away for a single to the leg side. Quick running made it a safe option in the end
122 kph, the first appearance of the slow bouncer, or perhaps that is Kula's regular bouncer? Anyways, ends up being ducked under all the same
124 kph, short of a length outside off and left well alone by the batsman
123 kph, on the front foot as this is fended away with delicate hands to the off side
124 kph, short of a length on middle and leg which is steered away through square leg

126 kph, and Kula strikes, or has he? McCullum wants a review. Kulasekera delivers this one on a length on and about off, with this one nipping into McCullum, who is late on it as he is hit on the back leg. This certainly looked out upon second viewing. Impact is given as umpire's call, so this means that this will remain out. Big wicket for Sri Lanka as Brendon departs the University Oval for just 25
takes away a lot of the pressure from Taylor's shoulders with a gentle wide down the leg side
and he gets away with an easy single through mid on to get his tally going
136 kph, might just be his day as he gets away a French cut to this fuller ball from just outside off, with the ball streaking away to the fine leg boundary

136 kph, this really is Ross Taylor's day. This time looking for the clip to this fullish length going down leg, with Taylor initially not looking for the run, then out of nowhere decides to go for it, with Kane pleading from the other end to think otherwise. The fielder close-in has a run at the ball, which Taylor sees as he stops and then returns back to his end before the throw. Would have been a comical way to go, but Ross lives to fight another day, or ball in this case
133 kph, defended away by Taylor
135 kph, nice punch through the covers by the batsman now as they are kept to two
136 kph, looks to force this fuller ball outside off through Lakmal, but the bowler is able to stop the ball
137 kph, gets this just back of a length to rear up on Taylor as he fends it away
128 kph, and he begins this spell with a leg-side delivery which is signaled by the umpire
130 kph, shifts the line to outside off, and at a length, as this one is defended away
131 kph, stays on the back foot as he gets nicely behind this back of a length which rears up appreciably
129 kph, ends up being late on this length on the pads, with the ball falling harmlessly towards the off side
133 kph, punched authoritatively off the back foot, but straight at the bowler in his follow through

133 kph, and Perera delivers for his captain in the first over itself as he gets Kane to nick at one just outside off, and deviating away a touch, as the ball carries through to Sangakkara, who is far too experienced to mess this one up. This time Williamson has to go and that is certainly one player the Sri Lankans will be more than happy to see the back of
135 kph, brings up the length on the same line as Elliott wisely gets forward to defend to end the over
tucked away off the back foot towards midwicket for one
onto the front foot as this is fended away just behind square on the off side
with no slip in place Elliott uses the width to run this down to third man, but is cut off by the fielder before the rope
rocks forward to look for the drop single outside off
brings the bat down in time to angle this away through the third man region
short and wide as this is slapped away through the off side, but not at all middled as they steal a quick single
132 kph, length just outside off and turned away to the leg side for one
134 kph, guided away through to mid on this time by the batsman
132 kph, shifts his weight back as he defends back to Perera
131 kph, short and just sits up for Elliott as he frees his arms to cut this away through backward point for a boundary
134 kph, fuller now as this is clipped to mid on
133 kph, rocks forward to defend with the softest of hands to bring the drinks cart onto the field
onto the front foot as this is steered to the fielder at mid off
tries to force it away through backward point but finds the fielder
defends on the front foot as the ball finds it way to mid off
defended away to the cover fielders by Taylor
tries to scythe away a fuller delivery outside off, but finds backward point
in the air as he slices at this one uppishly, with the ball spooning towards third man
134 kph, Taylor at his sublime best. In the slot and he just drives this on the up through extra-cover with such panache as the ball screams away to the rope
129 kph, Perera surprises him with the bouncer as Taylor, with his bat up, was looking to attack, before deciding to leave at the last moment
134 kph, rocks forward to defend this away to the cover fielder
132 kph, presents the straightest of bats to the bowler as this is defended back
130 kph, slaps away this short and wide delivery from Perera between backward point and third man as this crashes into the rope
134 kph, miscues this heave over midwicket, with the ball falling just short of mid on
131 kph, tries the bouncer down leg side as Taylor works this away with the angle to deep fine leg
gets this one horribly wrong as this is dished out well wide of off stump

unbelievable. Thirimanne has done it! Who would have thunk it? Taylor takes this fullish length wide of off and ends up slogging it over to the midwicket fielder, who just can't believe his luck as he takes a simple catch in the deep
and as Thirimanne slides one down the leg side, I think now is as good as time as ever to mention this is just his second ODI wicket
Anderson finally gets a legal delivery, and helps himself to a boundary through extra-cover with a well-timed drive
sensibly allows this one pitched outside off through to Sangakkara

wide from Thirimanne as Anderson is allowed room to free his arms and scythe this away through backward point, with third man running hard after it to try and cut it off, but looks like it may have ended in desperation. Replays confirm so soon after
lets this one outside off through to the keeper
this time defended away to the off side to end the over
129 kph, defended away to the fielder at mid off by the batsman
131 kph, tries to slap this one away through point, but finds the fielder
129 kph, squirted away to the leg side by Elliott to bring Anderson on strike
132 kph, shoulders arms to this length ball outside off
132 kph, fullish length now in the same channel as this is let through
128 kph, chops this back of a length outside his off stump, but is lucky it did not do any further damage
into position quickly to parry this away to the off side
eased away off the back foot to the man at sweeper cover
rocks forward before removing all limbs from the equation to this fuller one going across him
too full and on the pads as this is whipped away to mid on
shifts his weight back before punching this away through the off side

Thirimanne has tripled his ODI tally in the space of two overs. This time it is Anderson's turn to go as he is late on this fuller length ball which strikes him on middle, with the umpire raising the finger soon after. After blasting away two boundaries, Corey has got to go as they have no reviews left after McCullum used his, and with this pitching outside leg, looks like it would have been a useful one too
126 kph, glances away this leg-side delivery from Perera to backward square leg
132 kph, elects to leave this back of a length delivery outside off stump
129 kph, fuller now on the same line as this is struck back at the bowler
130 kph, run away off the back foot through the third man region as the pair run a brace
131 kph, into position quickly as he defended this off the front foot
132 kph, overpitched outside off and drilled straight to deep extra-cover for a couple
struck off the back foot towards the general direction of sweeper cover by Elliott
drilled firmly at the short cover fielder as he lands on top of the ball
ends up playing this one back to the bowler, who is keeping to a lovely line and length with little to no margin for error
tries to force one away through the covers, but ends up squirting it away behind square on the leg side to bring up the NZ 100
reaches out to fend at this one away to the off side
looking to get this one away through the covers, but ends up mishitting it more towards Thirimanne in his follow through
129 kph, gets nice and tall as he defends back to Perera
131 kph, far too early into the pull as he almost inside-edges one onto his stumps, with the ball hitting his thigh pad instead and landing safely on the off side
132 kph, hurries him up with a bouncer which rushes onto him as Ronchi just about manages to get on top of it before rolling his wrists to keep it down through midwicket
130 kph, guided firmly by the batsman to long off
130 kph, tries to steer one off the back foot past backward point, but the fielder puts in an excellent diving stop to deter that thought from the batsman's mind
128 kph, eased away off the pads to deep fine leg
darts in one from outside leg which is tucked away to the leg side
floated on middle and off and driven back to the bowler
gets himself into position to force this away off the back foot, but finds silly mid off
clipped away off the pads behind square for a single
onto the front foot and turned away to the leg side, with Elliott running the first hard before returning for the second
forced away through extra-cover by Elliott, but the fielder is able to put in a dive to stop the ball
leg-side delivery which stays low as Elliott fails to take full toll, dragging this away to deep square leg
short again as this time it is Ronchi's turn to find the man at deep square
drives this one just outside off but is stopped by the fielder at cover
short again, and going down leg, as this time Ronchi clears the front leg before picking his spot at midwicket to slog this for six
similar delivery as before, and ends with a simliar result, except a touch straighter through cow corner. Ronchi seems to hit boundaries in pairs!
tries to force it away on the leg side, but ends up hitting it a tad uppishly to Mendis in his follow through, but the ball dies before
continues from round the wicket as this one is eased down to long on
shifts his weight onto the back foot as he tucks it away through midwicket
fuller and on the pads as this is clipped to deep midwicket this time
seems to stop on him as he pushes at this one floated on off stump
gropes out at this fuller ball outside off
places this one beautifully off the back foot to deep extra-cover before being cut off by the boundary rider
defended away off the back foot towards the off side
sliding in on middle and leg as this is turned away to mid on
steered away through point to pickup a couple with some lively running
uses the subcontinental flick behind square as his fast hands generate enough pace for the ball to find the boundary
rocks back before slamming this one away to deep midwicket
uses the angle of this leg-side delivery to help it down to deep fine leg
able to sweep away this one going down the leg side for a single
short and just begging to be hit as this is slapped away off the back foot through extra-cover to find the boundary
reaches forward before defending this with soft hands
clips this one away down to the fielder at long on
once again looks to force it away through the leg side, but is thwarted by mid on
employs the sweep shot once more to this time find the man at deep backward square leg
scythes away a four through extra-cover to pickup four. Good shot that from Elliott
slipping down the leg side as Elliott overbalances as he looks to flick it away, with the keeper removing the bails from behind
opens the face now to maneuver this one away through the third man region for a single
defended from the crease towards the leg side
width outside off and crashed away to sweeper cover for one. The NZ 150 is brought up as well
runs this one outside off down to third man
steers another on the up, this time squarer off the wicket, as they run the single
punched away off the back foot, but finds the cover fielder
waits on the back foot before nurdling this one away to long on
eased away on the front foot to long on for one
miscues this slice a touch as he looks to blitz this one high over long on, with the ball instead carrying over to sweeper cover
uses his feet to get down to the pitch and strike it straight to long on
invites him to get forward as this time Ronchi gets a good hold on it, lifting it high over long on for a big six
128 kph, punched away through the covers off the back foot
124 kph, fended away off the back foot towards the general direction of the bowler
124 kph, short and sits up for the batsman as Elliott pulls this emphatically to the deep backward square leg
126 kph, reaches out before driving this one away on the off side
128 kph, wide again from Perera, except this time he finds the fielder at deep extra-cover
opens the face outside off to run this down to third man
floats in one on middle which is guided away to the off side
short and given room to back away as he punches this away for boundary through extra-cover
onto the back foot as this is punched away to the leg side
cut away hard to the cover fielder, but he is on top of it
driven emphatically at the long off fielder for a single
defends with the straightest of bats to end the over
and he is greeted to the crease with the cleanest of strikes over extra-cover to bring up his sixth ODI fifty. This one landed with one bounce to the boundary
134, full delivery just outside off which is turned into a low full toss as this is guided past the bowler to long off
136 kph, defended away with a slightly angled face
136 kph, runs the face of this one through point for a single
135 kph, in the slot and crashed straight at the extra-cover fielder
134 kph, able to place this overpitched delivery outside off through to deep extra-cover, but is cut off by the fielder before the rope
chipped down to long on by Elliott to get things going after drinks
clears the front leg to sweep this hard to square leg, with the fielder coming into play
turned away to the leg side by the batsman
finer this time from the batsman as he locates deep fine leg with a sweep
cut away off the back foot, but finds the fielder at cover
manages a couple down fine leg with a tickle

122 kph, and Kula almost gets one straightaway as he has Elliott driving at this uppishly straight to the fielder at silly mid off, who puts in a dive to his left, but bobbles the chance after he falls to the ground. Would have been a sensational start to Kula's spell had this been taken. Thirimanne is the guilty culprit in the field
125 kph, manages to squirt away a run past silly point to get off strike

126 kph, looking for the yorker but instead offers up an overpitched delivery outside off which is driven firmly by Ronchi to find the extra-cover boundary. Also brings up the century partnership in just 87 balls
107 kph, waits on it before deciding to club this away off the back foot through midwicket
125 kph, rocks forward before defending with soft hands

125 kph, Kula is really not enjoying the rub of the green here as this time Elliott gets away with a chop-on that runs behind to deep fine leg, allowing the batsman to run the two he needed to pickup a well-deserved fifty
short and some width on offer as he crashes one away through the packed off side, but picks up one of the five fielders stationed there
manages a single down to the man at short fine leg
eased away to the fielder at long on
good use of the feet to get to the pitch of this one pitched just outside leg, and then hammers it through the line through long off to find a useful boundary for NZ
Ronchi is proving to be dangerous here as he gets away a boundary, this time with a paddle sweep which beats short fine leg before getting to the rope
tries to work one away past short fine leg again, but this time the fielder is all over it
126 kph, able to just about dig this wide yorker to the off side, with the pair scampering a quick single
127 kph, shuffles over before turning this one away to the leg side
127 kph, steers this fuller one outside off straight to backward point
125 kph, Ronchi is in T20 mode at the moment as he puts away Kula high over long off as he lets slip yet another low full toss to be deposited
128 kph, overpitched again as this time Ronchi gets it away with a slice through point but didn't quite middle it as he would have liked

129 kph, eases this final ball of the Powerplay away to long on. NZ have turned it around with this five-over period. Ronchi has been setting it up beautifully thus far, with Elliott providing adequate foil
tries to force it away off the back foot past silly mid off, but he puts in a valiant dive
Ronchi is simply picking and choosing his spots as he rocks back to cut this away fiercely through extra-cover to find yet another boundary
this time dragged down the leg side as Ronchi follows suit, slogging at this hard to find the deep midwicket fielder
eased away off the back foot by Elliott, who uses the angle well as he gets it to short fine leg
cut away square off the wicket on the off side by Ronchi as he continues to motor along
employs the sweep to good effect to find deep fine leg
129 kph, plants the foot before scything away this length ball through to sweeper cover
132 kph, unable to land this fullish length as he offers up a low full toss which is crashed away to deep extra-cover, but is cut off before the rope
127 kph, plays an airy shot through the slip region which is safe as there are no fielders in the vicinity, with third man fielding the ball in the end

132 kph, flashes hard at this length which kicks up on him as the extra-bounce offers up an edge to where first slip would have gone, but no worries there as the ball ballooned high over before finding the advertising hoarding at third man
131 kph, picks up a single now to get off strike. In the 90s now is Ronchi
131 kph, gets some extra bounce once more as Elliott is late on this cut shot
uses the crease well to rock back and cut this away to deep extra-cover
follows the line of the delivery to tickle this away to fine leg
short again as Ronchi locates the fielder stationed at cow corner. Looking to bludgeon just about every ball is the former Australian wicketkeeper
Elliott drives at one firmly, finding the fielder at mid off. Sets off for the run straightaway and has to put in the dive to prevent a certain run-out

really risky running at the moment from NZ as another run-out opportunity goes begging. This time Ronchi flicks one away to midwicket, with the throw from the deep fired in at the non-strikers, as Ronchi ends up having to dive to make his ground at the other end to make his ground, but the way the ball bounced off the surface meant he was in all the time
defended away by Ronchi to end the over. Dilshan is furious as he is handed his cap by the umpire. Two chances gone to waste there for SL
130 kph, beautiful sound of the bat as this one is struck to the fielder at sweeper cover. The ball is certainly coming on nicely at the moment for the batsmen
134 kph, full toss which Ronchi should have deposited through cow corner, but is unable to get his bat under it quite so
133 kph, slips in a wide yorker which Ronchi reaches out to, but finds backward point in a hurry

133 kph, powerful strike from Ronchi which strikes the hand of Perera as he reached out to grab the chance. The ball ends up getting deflected onto the stumps before hitting the umpire on his leg, who has to run off as he favours the afflicted leg
132 kph, slapped away at the top of the bounce square off the wicket, but finds the fielder at point
131 kph, Elliott almost gives it away as he slices this away through the air in the same region, with the fielder at third man putting in a valiant dive to stop a certain boundary
pulls this shorter one high over cow corner, but locates the fielder
sensibly waits for this to come to him before tucking it away to midwicket
looks like this may have just clipped the pad on its way to the keeper as there seems to be two sounds, but replays show there really wasn't anything to write home about
manage to pickup a brace with a whip away to the leg side
gets down before easing this to long on for one
shifts his weight onto the back foot to punch this to the cover fielders, before a misfield in the ring allows for the run to be taken. Dilshan left fuming in his spot
135 kph, moves to 99 with a firm drive to long off. Ties his highest score of 99 against South Africa near the end of last year
133 kph, short and wide and given the treatment by Elliott, but he doesn't place it well as he ends up finding sweeper cover

131 kph, and he gets to a maiden ODI century by working away this length ball on middle and leg to midwicket as the University Oval crowd rise to what has been a fantastic counter-attack under pressure from the NZ batsman
130 kph, played at with soft hands to allow Ronchi to get back on strike
133 kph, full and wide this time outside off as Ronchi times this away to deep extra-cover
131 kph, looking for the drop single through gully but is restricted as the ball finds the fielder sooner than he would have liked
uses his feet beautifully to get to the pitch before lifting Dilshan over his head to find the straight boundary
sensibly eases this next one away to long on for one
steered away on the leg side by Elliott for one, with the close-in fielder putting in a dive
was on to this leg side delivery in a flash as he clears the front leg to slam this high over midwicket for a six , and the first of the innings for him
tries to force away a sweep round the corner, but finds leg slip
this time directed straight to the fielder at mid on to end the over
133 kph, drilled straight to the fielder at long off
waltzes down the track to try and pick the gap at long on, but the fielder is able to run to the right and back to cut this off with a dive
137 kph, delivers a fuller length delivery which just narrowly misses off as Ronchi plays down the wrong line, with Sangakkara completing the take from behind
134 kph, too full from the bowler and punished by Ronchi as he clubs this straight back through long on to find yet another boundary. This just whistled to the rope

135 kph, full toss and slammed high over cow corner as Ronchi, with 111 to his name, is not going to miss such a freebie. The bowling has really deteriorated from the visitors in the last ten-fifteen overs
132 kph, a simple length delivery and Ronchi ends the over with another huge six high over long on. He waited on this before bending one knee and lifting this high over for half a dozen
and Elliott greets him to the crease with a couple of steps down the track before chipping this over extra-cover to find an easy boundary. Elliott shifting up gears now
is late on this midwicket slog as he ends up mishitting more towards behind square on the leg side
pinpoints the gap through midwicket with a powerful sweep as good running affords the batsmen a pair
is well early as he looks to bludgeon this out of South Island
advances down before adjusting his shot to work it away to backward square

this time makes the sweet connection he sought as everything comes together to produce another hefty blow over cow corner for Luke Ronchi. Partnership has now moved into 200. Sensational stuff this from NZ
shuffles over to outside off as he seems to have read Kula's mind before hand, slamming this one high behind square leg to produce a huge six which sails high and mighty
126 kph, waits on it before chipping this elegantly to long off
127 kph, delivers the wide yorker which Ronchi has to grope at as he just about hits this away through extra-cover
122 kph, slices this one high over point, with sweeper cover fielding the ball after one bounce
128 kph, low full toss and Ronchi sees it well early to bludgeon this high over cow corner. Not sure whether this has landed yet. Ronchi is having the match of his life
127 kph, forces one away on the off side through the covers to finish off another good over for the hosts
135 kph, low full toss and you guessed it, this one screams away to the boundary. Clears his front leg and then slams this hard through extra-cover as this whistles away
134 kph, good thinking from Lakmal as he slips in a bouncer which Ronchi was unable to get any bat on
135 kph, full toss from Lakmal and Ronchi metes out the appropriate punishment, carting this high over cow corner for his bajillionth sixth

149 kph, fastest ball of the day is sent away in the fastest way possible. Cut away powerfully square off the wicket and Ronchi now moves to 151. Take a bow, Luke, this has been an outstanding counter-attacking innings under pressure
133 kph, this is just ludicrous now. Moves to 159 as he is given yet another hit-me ball to go after, which he does with aplomb as the ball sails over cow corner into the stands

136 kph, another full toss which he gets down the leg side as Ronchi is able to follow it to hit it uppishly over midwicket for a brace. Takes him to 161, but more importantly for SL, he is off strike for the time being
128 kph, and the hit-fest continues as Elliott gets one away through midwicket, but doesn't quite middle it so. Looks like it was another low full toss from the bowler as well
130 kph, able to clatter away Kula through extra-cover with a meaty blow as he gets into the 90s now

122 kph, wide and full as Elliott moves over before slicing this through the gap at third man to find the boundary. Also brings up the 250-run partnership between these two. Simply breathtaking batting

129 kph, and now it is Grant Elliott's turn to get saluted by the crowd as he picks up the single through the off side to add to his ODI century tally. Has really been a brilliant knock by Elliott, and should not be overshadowed at all by Ronchi's fiercy effort at the other end. Played his role to perfection did Elliott
130 kph, lasers one away on a bended knee down to deep extra-cover
129 kph, advances down the track but is late on this one pitched outside off. First miss in a while from any of these batsmen really
138 kph, they pinch a run through the off side with a drop single executed by Elliott
137 kph, straight from the bowler but Ronchi in this kind of form is just too good as he blitzes this one back past the bowler to find the long off boundary in a hurry

138 kph, dropped short one which follows the batsman as Ronchi goes after it, which he has to at this stage of the innings. Ends up offering a high chance to the cover fielder who has to run behind and try to take it, with the ball ending up being bobbled in the deep as he went down
131 kph, this time steered away through backward point as some quick running turns it into two
130 kph, drills this one straight past the bowler to the long on fielder

139 kph, back of a length which Ronchi just about gets away with a slap through long on as the pair run the first hard to comeback for the second and end what has been an unbelievable partnership by these two

inn2.comm: begins with a middle and leg stump line, Thirimanne defends it into the on-side
length delivery on middle, Thirimanne defends it back on the track
fullish and angling away outside off, Thirimanne lifts his bat and lets it go
on a good length and on off and middle, Thirimanne defends it to mid on
full outside off, Thirimanne leans forward, opens the face of the bat and drives it square of the wicket, the batsmen take three before the ball is chased down
delivers a wide first up as the umpire makes the signal
gets nicely behind the line of this Boult special
135 kph, slips one on a fifth stump line which is shouldered arms to
137 kph, rocks forward to defend the line of this just back of a length
135 kph, tries out a leg-side delivery which is tickled past the keeper to the fine leg boundary
131 kph, this will certainly help with the chase as now he delivers wides down the leg side which Ronchi is unable to grasp
133 kph, shifts the line of attack to outside off stump as he defends inside of the line, with the ball continuing through
140 kph, fuller one on the pads which Dilshan tries to work away on the leg side, but is late on
144 kph, Southee touching the 90s now as Dilshan has a flash at this length ball outside off, slicing one away through third man, which is stopped before the rope
141 kph, full and on the pads as this is clipped away to deep midwicket by Thirimanne
141 kph, gets this one to curl in appreciably after pitching across the batsman
138 kph, looks to cut away through square off the wicket, but the ball cuts back in as he plays outside of the line
142 kph, fuller and in the same channel as Thirimanne shoulders arms
138 kph, gets this one to nip in from a back of a length as this is run down to third man
137 kph, squeezes away this back of a length outside off down to the fielder at third man
135 kph, the shape in means Dilshan is struck on the pad, but this did a bit too much for lbw to be called into question
137 kph, some width on offer from Boult as this is crashed away behind square
138 kph, allows this back of a length to carry through to the keeper
139 kph, gets nicely behind this back of a length to mark the end of the over
137 kph, allows this one outside his off stump to go through to the keeper
139 kph, gets this outswinger to nip away at the last moment as Dilshan plays inside of the line. Southee has been in good rhythm so far this spell. The speed is definitely up
142 kph, pushed up on middle and leg as this is defended by the batsman on the front foot
141 kph, looked to force this one away through the covers, but ends up miscuing back towards the bowler
142 kph, straying down the pads as this is flicked behind square on the leg side, with the ball just beating out the fielder to the rope
141 kph, blitzes away this fuller one on middle and leg to the long on fielder
138 kph, looked to clip away this delivery honing on middle and leg, with the ball getting a leading edge and popping to the off side instead
135 kph, this time fends away Boult towards the cover fielders on the off side
134 kph, tries to crash this one away through the line on the off side but is late on it
138 kph, fuller one on the pads which is neatly tucked away by the batsman
140 kph, looks to chop this one away through the gully region, but doesn't quite get it away so
137 kph, swinging delivery on the pads which Dilshan is late on as he looks to whip it away
138 kph, delivers a hefty bouncer which climbs high over Lahiru as the umpire signals the crowd
140 kph, fuller this time on the same line as Lahiru is right behind it
140 kph, tries to flick this one away past the keeper but Ronchi, after his 170*, is right on top of this
140 kph, better line and length as he gets this one to curl in from outside off. Defended by Lahiru on the front foot

140 kph, too good from Southee as he pitches this in that awkward region where the batsman is unsure on whether to go forward or back. This one streaks past the outside edge as it streaked away to the keeper
143 kph, invited to go forward to this fullish length on the pads as this is clipped away to deep midwicket
141 kph, able to pickup a quick single on the leg side with a firm drive towards mid on
135 kph, strikes Dilshan on the thigh pad as the batsmen scamper a leg bye
139 kph, gets nicely on top of the bounce as this is fended away to the off side
137 kph, tries to glance away this middle and leg delivery for a quick single on the leg side, but hits it a bit too quickly to the close-in fielder on that side
140 kph, fullish length on middle and leg as this is tucked away neatly to mid on
140 kph, umpire motions to the crowd that a wide has been delivered as Southee gets back to his mark. Was short and wide from the bowler
138 kph, presses forward before playing this one with soft hands to the off side
138 kph, a sliver of fortune for Thirimanne as he gets an outside edge which flies safely to the third man fielder
139 kph, delivers a good length, swinging delivery which Thirimanne comes forward to defend
137 kph, latches onto this short ball from Southee as he pulls emphatically to the midwicket boundary. Excellent control of the shot as he executed
139 kph, wonderful pickup by Lahiru high over deep square leg as he uses the angle of the swing to lift this high over the area for the first six of the innings
139 kph, tries to open the face now to run this delivery outside off to third man
138 kph, pushes at this back of a length going across him towards the off side
139 kph, flashes hard at this back of a length, getting this one away through backward point to find the boundary in a flash
137 kph, Dilshan in on the act now as he pinpoints the gap through long off with a push at this length ball outside off. Hit on the up and timed beautifully by the Sri Lankan opener
138 kph, elects to leave this one pitched about just back of a length as it goes across him to the keeper
140 kph, wide and in the slot for Dilshan as he is given room to free his arms and scythe this away through the third man region, with the fielder making a good stop before the boundary
138 kph, almost succeeds in dragging one on to his stumps as this one streaks away behind towards fine leg. Also brings up the 50-run partnership between these two
137 kph, better line and length from Boult, this one pitching on a fifth stump line and swinging away as Lahiru presents the face
137 kph, opens the face to this back of a length outside off to run it past backward point for a single
starts from round the wicket as he flights this on middle, with the batsman guiding it away through the off side for one
shortens the length a touch on off, Dilshan makes room and dabs it to backward point
133 kph, delivers a length ball on leg which is pulled away behind square on the leg side by Dilshan
140 kph, fullish length which is neatly tucked away on the leg side by Lahiru
140 kph, picks up a single through the off side to get Dilshan back on strike
137 kph, slapped away on the up by Dilshan to extra-cover to rotate the strike
134 kph, delivers a bouncer which Lahiru gets up and under as this is ramped over to third man
140 kph, shifts the line a touch closer to the body on a fourth stump line as Dilshan is late on it as he looks to run it away through gully
given room to cut this one away behind square on the off side
advances down before striking this one firmly to the long off fielder
eased away off the pads to midwicket for another straightforward single
defended with soft hands as McCullum picks up the rebound
cut away by Lahiru towards the third man region as he completes a brace
gets deep into the crease before shuffling to the leg side to work this down to midwicket
131 kph, begins with a length ball going across Lahiru which he follows the line of as it continues past to the keeper
132 kph, gets this to nip back from a length as Lahiru just about manages to defend it away as he was cramped for room by the angle
135 kph, shifts the line wider outside off as Lahiru finds a single through cover
133 kph, short ball which Dilshan's eyes light up to as he is into position quickly to swivel and pull this behind square to find the boundary
134 kph, bit more pace on the same line as this time Mitchell beats him with a better-placed bouncer that Dilshan is unable to get any bat on as it takes off from the surface
135 kph, finishes off his first over of the spell with a well-directed length ball on middle and off
looks to chip this over extra-cover, but is fortunate for this not to go to hand as it stayed in the air for a quite a bit
goes down the track to this flighted delivery outside off as Dilshan ends up drilling this straight to the mid off fielder
backs away before cutting this in front of square to rotate strike
darts in quicker one on the pads which Dilshan is rushed into playing the paddle, which he doesn't middle at all
once again advances down, this time hitting it towards the general vicinity of long on
defended with a nice, angled bat as the ball lands dead near him
138 kph, unable to find a run through the leg side to this McClenaghan length ball going across him
134 kph, this time forces away a shot on the up through the covers as he runs hard to complete two
130 kph, short ball which just sits up for Dilshan as he is into position quickly to pull this through midwicket for another useful boundary
133 kph, looks like he was well into this hook before it even arrived to him as this bouncer screams past Dilshan's head. Ends up being signaled one for the over by the umpire
137 kph, firmly strikes one at the mid off fielder before setting off for a single to the other end, and is able to make his ground in the nick of time despite the throw at his end
137 kph, rocks forward to defend this one softly to the leg side to end the over
slips in one outside off which Dilshan wanted to attack before reluctantly playing it back to the bowler
short from Elliott as Dilshan shifts his weight onto the back foot to cut this away through extra-cover
finds the gap through third man to bissect the field as this looked like it may have just beat the fielder to the rope, but you can never really discount this top NZ fielding unit
once again looks to run the face to pick up runs but doesn't get it as far this time
advances down the track before adjusting his stroke to fend the ball away to the off side
cut away by Lahiru through backward point to keep the strike
135 kph, turned away towards the direction of mid on by Lahiru
133 kph, tried to scythe this one away through the covers, but is stopped dead in his tracks
this time clipped away to the leg side as Dilshan is able to get to the other end
fires in a quicker one on middle and off which Dilshan is late on as he is struck on the pads, but it looks like he may have got an inside-edge as the umpire remains unmoved
this time into position to force one away on the up through extra-cover, with the fielders in the deep doing well to track the ball before the boundary

gets a top-edge to this bouncer from McClenaghan which flies high over fine leg to get over the rope for half a dozen. Extremely fortuitous that for Sri Lanka as they need to accelerate the run rate somewhat
defended by the batsman to the off side as Elliott gets us going after the break
fended away carefully by the batsman to the off side

short and it looks like the break has claimed yet another victim as the lack of pace from Elliott meant Lahiru had to bring some of his own into the shot as he looked to hook high over backward square, but ends up holing to the fielder in the deep. A steady knock from the stand-in captain comes to an end, and Sri Lanka lose their first wicket in this big chase
Dilshan on strike now as the batsmen had crossed over. Ends up defending this to the leg side with soft hands
chips this one over midwicket to get off strike
driven firmly to the fielder at mid off as Sangakkara sees off his first delivery
strikes Mitchell firmly through the off side, but is unlucky to find the silly mid off fielder, who is behind it comfortably
fuller in the same channel and this time Dilshan blazes away, more in the direction of extra-cover, as this whistles away to the boundary. Guptill had no chance at short extra-cover
tries to force another one away on the up but the close-in fielder is able to get to it. Can't prevent the quick single though
too full from the bowler and punished as Dilshan uncorks a beautiful drive on the up which finds its way to the deep extra-cover boundary
full and wide again from Mitch as this is hammered in the same area, with Guptill at short extra-cover putting in a wonderful diving stop to parry this
counters with the pull shot as Mitchell drops it short, and in the process brings up his fifty as well. An excellent knock as his team would badly have wanted him out there for as long as possible
delivers this one well wide of off as Dilshan is late on it. Looked to the umpire for support, but no wide signal given
looks to work this length ball on middle and leg behind square. Dilshan wanted two but Sangakkara wisely sends him back when he sees the fielder come across the ball
round the wicket now to Sanga as he fails to chip him over midwicket, chasing after this wide one outside off. Didn't need to put the initial effort in though as this is judged wide by the umpire
given room outside his off stump to run this down to a squarish third man
tucked away through long on for a comfortable single
pushes at this one rather uppishly as the ball continues down to the long on region
and our first glimpse of the famous Dilscoop he trademarked as he just about gets bat on ball to lift this over the keeper's head, but not as far as he would have desired
starts off with a loosener on the pads which is tickled behind by Dilshan to the fine leg boundary
drilled firmly by the batsman to the fielder at mid on
tries to force away a drive through point, but the fielder is able to get behind it
runs this with an open face down to third man for one
waltzes down to try and heave Anderson over long on, but is late on the ball
guided away expertly by Sangakkara through point to retain strike
short and slanting down leg as Kumar shuffles over to the leg side before pulling this to midwicket
onto the back foot as this is steered down to long on
round the wicket to the left-hander as Sangakkara plays at it with soft hands
looks to run this one past gully, but finds the fielder in a hurry so gets back to his end
backs away before waiting for this to arrive, then punches it away on the back foot through cover
once again looks to force it away through the packed off side, but finds the close-in fielder
fended away off the back foot by Dilshan as the ball rolls to the cover fielder
overpitched by Anderson as Dilshan gets down on one knee before blazing away through the covers to get four
finds the fielder at mid off this time as another dot eats up the ball count
fuller this time on middle and off as this is directed away to the leg side
manages to pick up a single through the gully region to get Sangakkara back on strike
eased away off the back foot just behind square on the leg side for another straightforward single
gets on one knee to try and scythe one through extra-cover, but the fielder stationed there gets right behind it
this time steered away behind square by Dilshan as Sangakkara comes back on strike
is well early on this leg-side slanting delivery as Sangakkara creates room to try and heave this through cow corner, but ends up missing it as the ball continues on through fine leg to get byes
opens the face to run this one down to the man at sweeper cover
fails to find the gap on the leg side as Elliott gets in another dot
finishes off with an offcutter which Dilshan is able to fend off to see the over through
137 kph, slips in a fullish length outside off which is square-driven by Sangakkara to the boundary rider
120 kph, picks the slower one early before planting his foot and blasting this away to find the gap, and more importantly, the boundary for SL
133 kph, way too early into this pull as Ronchi collects from behind
119 kph, another slower ball which Dilshan is able to reach out to as he gets it away square off the wicket
122 kph, fires in a slow yorker just outside off as Sangakkara digs it out to the off side
135 kph, Dilshan plays an elegant straight drive which just races away across the turf as he gets himself into the 70s

Elliott strikes again as his golden day continues in the form of Sangakkara's dismissal from the middle. Delivers a back-of-the-hand slower ball which Sangakkara fails to see as he chips over mid on, with long on getting under it to take the catch safely. Would be frustrating for the left-hander as he endeavoured to build a start to support Dlishan at the other end
is well late on this length ball outside off as Ronchi collects from behind
Mahela almost giving it away there as he just about carts this shorter one high over midwicket, but away from any fielder. Gets him off the mark too
this time it is Dilshan's turn to rock back and pull to the leg side
angling down the pads as Mahela employs the flick to good effect to pickup a brace
looks to work this one very fine from middle and leg as he brings the bat down to sweet, but ends up getting a top-edge which flies high over, but far enough to evade any danger
132 kph, starts off with a loosener wide of off, and short, as Mahela cuts it away behind square for one
136 kph, fails to pick the line of this one shaping in from outside off as he ends up playing down the wrong channel, with the ball ducking inside of the line
135 kph, on the back foot right away as this is defended close to the body
133 kph, drives this fuller one straight to mid off
138 kph, solidly behind the line of this back of a length outside off
138 kph, manages to strike the pads with this delivery on middle and leg, but definitely looked like it was going down leg as the umpire remained nonplussed
cut away behind square to find the boundary rider stationed at third man, who does well to keep it two
cuts this one away just outside off, but can't get it past the fielder at gully
extremely fortunate to get away with an outside edge on middle which ends up streaking away past the slips to the third man boundary
once again looking to pierce the gap between slip and backward point, with one of the fielders on the off side coming in now to plug the gap
this time guided away off the back foot to long on for a single
finishes off with a length delivery on middle which is eased away softly to the leg side
137 kph, full and straight as Dilshan is good enough to clip this away through midwicket to find the boundary. Also gets himself into the 80s with that stroke
137 kph, this time looking to force the issue through the covers, but doesn't quite middle it
137 kph, searching for the yorker on middle but ends up giving up a low full toss which is eased away by Dilshan to find four more
137 kph, picks this one from outside off before angling it away with the bat through midwicket to beat the boundary rider to the rope
134 kph, intended to steer this through the off side, but ends up miscuing more towards long on. Gets him off strike nonetheless
136 kph, tries to run this one pitched outside off through third man, but is picked up by the boundary rider
employs the late cut to try and beat short third man, but to no avail
gentle outswinger from Elliott which is nudged away by the batsman to the off side
waits on it before playing with soft hands to get to the other end and bring Dilshan on strike
this time steered down to long on for one
going down the leg side as Mahela waits on it before helping it on its way to deep fine leg
tests him out with a bouncer which Dilshan, into his 90s, is not going to miss out on as he just about hooks this one away to the fine leg boundary
fuller one going across as this is struck firmly to the man at mid off
able to execute a drop single to perfection with a bunt-and-run just outside off
has a go at this wider yorker from Anderson, but is late on it as the slower ball comes out
gets just enough width outside off to free his arms and force this away past the boundary rider at third man to get four. Needed runs for SL here
this time looks to glide one away in front of square, but doesn't quite middle it so
strikes this fuller one just outside off straight at the short cover fielder, who puts in a valiant dive to take off most of the pace
Dilshan almost gave it away as he sits on 99 as he chips at this one uppishly in the direction of silly mid on, who puts in a dive, but can't quite reach to it
and Dilshan's impressive tour continues as he reaches a 20th ODI century with a drive on the up through the covers. Looks up to the heavens to thank the almighty, but there is still much left to do
glanced away off the back foot to deep fine leg
brings out the scoop now as he just about paddles this over to the fine leg region. Able to get two before an errant throw at the striker's end allows for an extra, welcome run for the tourists
this time steered away by Mahela to the man at deep extra-cover
waits on it before opening the face, but just can't get it past the gully fielder
slips in a yorker outside off which Mahela just about manages to dig out, but nowhere where he can pinch a single though
looks to lift Corey high over extra-cover, but is late on this slightly wide delivery. Ends up being signaled as wide by the umpire
is cramped for room as he just about runs this away down to third man
sees this is a touch short as he gets down the pitch before clubbing through the line to find the boundary at long off
stand and deliver stuff from Dilshan as this time he clatters Anderson straight back, with the allrounder getting some hand on it as the ball heads towards the long on and off fielders
given width outside his off stump and Mahela shows his class by bissecting the gap to pickup a boundary through backward point
full and straight as this is clipped efficiently off the pads to the man at long on
uses the leg-side angle of the delivery to maneuver this behind square on the leg side for one
floated on leg as Dilshan gets to the pitch to turn this into a low full toss before hammering it away through midwicket

dropped and the plan does come off, but not quite as NZ would have liked as Mahela is enticed to go after a fuller one on leg which bobbles up high to backward square leg, who fails to pick it as he ran back and to his right
manages to pickup a single on the leg side

strikes the pads on the full as Nathan is interested in the appeal. They do have a deliberation about it but Ronchi doesn't seem as interested so they decide to not go for it. Mahela was looking for the reverse sweep as he switched sides, with him eventually getting struck just outside what would have been his leg stump
able to pickup a useful boundary down fine leg to end the over on a good note. Nathan would have loved to have got Mahela that previous ball
135 kph, starts off with a back of a length ball on middle and leg which is defended away to the leg side

135 kph, hits through the line of this length delivery going across him, immediately setting off for the single as the ball raced to the mid on fielder, who under pressure ends up bobbling a chance to fire in a throw at the non-striker's

139 kph, is late on this fuller one as this strikes the top of Dilshan's pads as he went for the swivel to pull. The ball continued on past the keeper to the third man boundary, but is cut off before the rope

123 kph, slower ball which Dilshan fails to get away with a flick on the leg side, but they still run the single as Mahela is eager to get to the other end, with Dilshan just about making his ground as Guptill threw one in at his end

139 kph, and Boult has given what Brendon wanted! Mahela has to depart the Oval after playing all around this delivery going across him, with the right-hander going across his stumps before looking to employ the paddle past fine leg. Boult saw it early and adjusted the line to careen into Mahela's off stump. Ends a spirited knock from Mahela, and puts NZ slightly ahead now on the cards
137 kph, ends up playing-and-missing at this just back of a length ball going across him
136 kph, tries to get in the yorker but ends up offering a low full toss which Dilshan flicks away effortlessly over backward square to find the rope

132 kph, and the plan has come off to perfection as McClenaghan has taken arguably the most decisive wicket, as he gets Dilshan to go after this shorter one which he looked to get under and over cover, but ends up spooning an easy chance to the extra-cover fielder, who takes it with glee
132 kph, keeping to that leg-stump line as Kula just about gets it away for a single
135 kph, sensibly draws his bat and limbs in to this back of a length delivered outside off
135 kph, pierces the gap on the off side with a forceful drive through the covers, and ends up finding a boundary as the ball races away from the chasing fielders
134 kph, reaches out to this fullish length and plays at it with soft hands to execute a drop single
133 kph, works with the slanting angle to tickle this down to fine leg
139 kph, looks to pull this shorter one from Boult through midwicket, but ends up slicing this high over backward point, but safe from any fielders

137 kph, and Boult strikes now as Kula's short stay comes to an end. Looking to hook this shorter one but this was onto him too quickly as the ball ends up spooning behind to Ronchi, who doesn't have to travel too far to take the catch
141 kph, gets high on his tippy-toes as this is defended away off the back foot

135 kph, tries to get Mendis to hole out with the hook to fine leg, but he got a bit more on this then the bowler expected as this sailed over the fielder. The short boundaries certainly helped there as well
141 kph, ends up retaining the strike as he tucks away this back of a length to the leg side
135 kph, defends this first ball of the over from McClenaghan to the off side
131 kph, gets this one far too short as the umpire signals to the crowd
131 kph, has a flash at this shorter one outside off, with Mendis late on it as he got both feet off the ground in an endeavour to chase it
135 kph, heaved over mid on to find the boundary rider
132 kph, pokes this one down to the man at mid on
134 kph, bends his knee as he looks to drive on the up through long off, but Brendon McCullum is equal to the task

132 kph, far too early in the stroke as he offers up an edge to Ronchi, who takes it comfortably enough. The extra bounce did him in there as Mitchell takes another one. Chandimal departs the Oval without troubling the scorers
fended away to the off side by the batsman
137 kph, has a wild slog at this length ball shaping away, missing it completely
139 kph, angling in on the pads as this is flicked away to deep fine leg

137 kph, and this time Perera has to go as he too doesn't trouble the scorers much as he flashes hard at this short and wide delivery from Boult, with the ball carrying straight to Kane at backward point

dropped fuller one which is driven straight back to the bowler as he fails to take the catch on his follow through. The batsman think about taking a single before Brendon appears in a flash and fires in a throw from mid off, with the stumps getting knocked down, thereby dissuading any further run intentions from the Sri Lankans
129 kph, straying down the pads as this is clipped away to backward square

136 kph, takes this fuller one from outside off to try and slog it over midwicket, but ends up miscuing it high over backward square, with Taylor making a mess of it as he loses sight of it in the air. Plenty of chuckles going around the ground at the moment
136 kph, onto the back foot before pulling this one straight to the midwicket fielder
135 kph, fuller one outside off which is drilled to mid off
136 kph, gets into lovely position quickly to uncork a drive through the covers, with the chasing fielders unable to pull it back before the boundary
135 kph, fails to get away this pull shot through midwicket
137 kph, defended away by Dimith to the off side
119 kph, tries out the slower ball as Dimuth just about manages to get bat on ball, but did not time this away at all
141 kph, tries to pinch a single through mid on but is sent back by his partner

114 kph, outstanding slower ball to get Mendis as he looked to get low and sweep this through fine leg, similar to what Mahela tried against him when he was dismissed. Ends up getting his middle peg knocked back as Sri Lanka go eight down
141 kph, honing on the pads as Sachi gets off the mark with a clip down to fine leg
137 kph, opens the face to run this one down to third man to end a successful over for the hosts
132 kph, steered away through the off side by the batsman
133 kph, able to glide this one to third man to get a single
134 kph, gets nicely on top of this shorter one from Mitch, with this one landing on the bounce to the deep midwicket fielder
133 kph, able to defend this one away on the back foot to the off side
131 kph, tucked away off the pads just behind square on the leg side
134 kph, pushes at this length ball uppishly through the off side as Mitch sticks out his mitt to try and grasp it

133 kph, and the move looks to have paid dividends as Dimuth makes it nine down as he holes out to Brendon at mid off with a forceful shot. New Zealand just one away from wrapping up a big victory here in Dunedin
136 kph, pushes at this full toss, which was meant for the blockhole, as the ball is collected at mid off
135 kph, guided away off the back foot, but straight to the fielder at point
133 kph, and it is all over at the University Oval as Lakmal plays all around this fuller one on middle and leg
